Related to sol, Sol, Surya, and Helios. More at solar.

entries.meaning: (astronomy) A star, especially when seen as the centre of any single solar system.
The light and warmth which is received from the sun; sunshine or sunlight.
(figurative) Something like the sun in brightness or splendor.
examples: I will never consent to put out the sun of sovereignity to posterity.

entries.meaning: A revolution of the Earth around the Sun; a year.
A transversing of the sky by the Sun; a day.
The nineteenth trump/major arcana card of the Tarot.

verbs.description: sun (third-person singular simple present suns, present participle sunning, simple past and past participle sunned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To expose to the warmth and radiation of the sun.
examples: Beautiful bodies lying on the beach, sunning their bronzed limbs.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To warm or dry in the sunshine.
(intransitive) To be exposed to the sun.
(intransitive, alternative medicine) To expose the eyes to the sun as part of the Bates method.

description: From Japanese ÂØ∏ (sun). Doublet of cun.

entries.meaning: A traditional Japanese unit of length, approximately 30.3 millimetres (1.193 inches).
